title: Sulli filmed new commercial and spoke to manager hours before her tragic death
text:
Sulli died on Monday (Picture: Jang Se-young/Newsis via AP)

Sulli was still working hours before her tragic death aged 25.

The former f(x) star was found dead at her home in Seongdam by her manager at 3.20pm, with parademics arriving at 3.29pm and confirming her death.

A police official said that her death was a suspected suicide, saying: ‘Choi seemed to have lived alone in the house.

‘It seems that she took her own life but we are also looking into other possibilities.’

And Sulli’s manager had been in touch with the K-pop star, real name Choi Jin-ri, the day before her passing.

The star had been working the day before her death (Picture: Instagram)

He said: ‘The last time I talked with Sulli was the night before around 6:30pm (KST). I haven’t heard from her since then so I came over to her found and found her dead.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

And on Sunday, Sulli had reportedly been filming an ad for the brand Stretch Angels in Gwanggyo, Suwon.

Ahead of the filming, the Goblin singer had shared a post on Instagram showing that Stretch Angels had sent her a gift of multiple bags from their range.

This was Sulli’s final Instagram post to her 6 million followers; Stretch Angels had also shared the post as a highlight on their page.

The Busan-born star had also just made her solo debut four months ago, releasing the single album Goblin, containing the songs Goblin, Sailor Moon and Dorothy, on 29 June.

In 2018, Sulli made a brief return to music to feature on Dean’s track Dayfly.

Sulli debuted with f(x) alongside Amber Liu, Victoria, Luna and Krystal in 2009, achieving huge success with songs including Pinocchio (Danger) and Electric Shock.

However, in 2014, SM Entertainment announced she would be taking a hiatus, saying: ‘f(x) member Sulli became mentally and physically exhausted from the continuous, malicious comments and false rumours, and has expressed her wish to take a break from her celebrity activities for the time being.’

Sulli quit the band for good in August 2015, and chose to focus on acting instead, achieving critical acclaim for her role in the TV drama To The Beautiful You.

Need support? Contact the Samaritans For emotional support you can call the Samaritans 24-hour helpline on 116 123, email jo@samaritans.org, visit a Samaritans branch in person or go to the Samaritans website.

description: Sulli filmed a new commercial for Stretch Angels the day before she died in an apparent suicide.
